bcamTrapString.name: bcamTrapString
bcamTrapString.description: Textual description of the trap. The trap string contains the values sent with the trap in printable form separated by the keywords given at the description of the individual traps.

bcamTrapOutPoolOverCurrent.name: bcamTrapOutPoolOverCurrent
bcamTrapOutPoolOverCurrent.description: The number of bytes of resident memory used for output cells when the trap condition (output pool over maximum) has been recognized.

bcamTrapOutPoolUnderCurrent.name: bcamTrapOutPoolUnderCurrent
bcamTrapOutPoolUnderCurrent.description: The number of bytes of resident memory used for output cells when the trap condition (output pool under maximum) has been recognized.

bcamTrapInPoolOverCurrent.name: bcamTrapInPoolOverCurrent
bcamTrapInPoolOverCurrent.description: The number of bytes of resident memory used for input cells when the trap condition (input pool over maximum) has been recognized.

bcamTrapInPoolUnderCurrent.name: bcamTrapInPoolUnderCurrent
bcamTrapInPoolUnderCurrent.description: The number of bytes of resident memory used for input cells when the trap condition (input pool under maximum) has been recognized.

bcamTrapOutPoolOver.name: bcamTrapOutPoolOver
bcamTrapOutPoolOver.description: This trap will be sent if the resident memory used for output cells exceeds the limit (bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap) for more than 5 seconds. bcamTrapString has the fields: $HOST$: <hostname> $UPTIME$: <bcamuptime> $OUTLIMIT$: <memlimit> $OUTCURRENT$: <memcurrent> The following values will be sent together with the trap: bcamGlobalHostName bcamGlobalUpTime bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap bcamMemoryPoolOverCurrent bcamTrapString

bcamTrapOutPoolUnder.name: bcamTrapOutPoolUnder
bcamTrapOutPoolUnder.description: This trap will be sent if the resident memory used for output cells has exceeded the limit (bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap) and falls under the limit for more than 5 seconds. bcamTrapString has the fields: $HOST$: <hostname> $UPTIME$: <bcamuptime> $OUTLIMIT$: <memlimit> $OUTCURRENT$: <memcurrent> The following values will be sent together with the trap: bcamGlobalHostName bcamGlobalUpTime bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap bcamMemoryPoolUnderCurrent bcamTrapString

bcamTrapInPoolOver.name: bcamTrapInPoolOver
bcamTrapInPoolOver.description: This trap will be sent if the resident memory used for input cells exceeds the limit (bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap) for more than 5 seconds. bcamTrapString has the fields: $HOST$: <hostname> $UPTIME$: <bcamuptime> $INLIMIT$: <memlimit> $INCURRENT$: <memcurrent> The following values will be sent together with the trap: bcamGlobalHostName bcamGlobalUpTime bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap bcamTrapInPoolOverCurrent bcamTrapString

bcamTrapInPoolUnder.name: bcamTrapInPoolUnder
bcamTrapInPoolUnder.description: This trap will be sent if the resident memory used for input cells has exceeded the limit (bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap) and falls under the limit for more than 5 seconds. bcamTrapString has the fields: $HOST$: <hostname> $UPTIME$: <bcamuptime> $INLIMIT$: <memlimit> $INCURRENT$: <memcurrent> The following values will be sent together with the trap: bcamGlobalHostName bcamGlobalUpTime bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap bcamTrapInPoolUnderCurrent bcamTrapString

bcamTrapLinkUp.name: bcamTrapLinkUp
bcamTrapLinkUp.description: This trap will be sent if an interface enters the state active (bcamIfAdminState). bcamTrapString has the fields: $HOST$: <hostname> $UPTIME$: <bcamuptime> $NUMBER$: <linknumber> $NAME$: <linkname> The following values will be sent together with the trap: bcamGlobalHostName bcamGlobalUpTime bcamIfTabNumbers bcamIfTabName bcamTrapString

bcamTrapLinkDown.name: bcamTrapLinkDown
bcamTrapLinkDown.description: This trap will be sent if an interface leaves the state active (bcamIfAdminState). bcamTrapString has the fields: $HOST$: <hostname> $UPTIME$: <bcamuptime> $NUMBER$: <linknumber> $NAME$: <linkname> The following values will be sent together with the trap: bcamGlobalHostName bcamGlobalUpTime bcamIfTabNumbers bcamIfTabName bcamTrapString

bcamTrapSystemUp.name: bcamTrapSystemUp
bcamTrapSystemUp.description: This trap will be sent after a successful start of BCAM. bcamTrapString has the fields: $HOST$: <hostname> $UPTIME$: <bcamuptime> The following values will be sent together with the trap: bcamGlobalHostName bcamGlobalUpTime bcamTrapString

bcamGlobalBcamVersion.name: bcamGlobalBcamVersion
bcamGlobalBcamVersion.description: The version of BCAM in the form xx.yy xx: mainversion yy: subversion

bcamGlobalMibVersion.name: bcamGlobalMibVersion
bcamGlobalMibVersion.description: Version of BCAM specific MIB (beginning with 1). Will be increased with every enhancement of this MIB

bcamGlobalUpTime.name: bcamGlobalUpTime
bcamGlobalUpTime.description: Time in seconds since start of BCAM

bcamGlobalPortNonpriv.name: bcamGlobalPortNonpriv
bcamGlobalPortNonpriv.description: The lowest port number that may be used by non privileged applications

bcamGlobalPortFree.name: bcamGlobalPortFree
bcamGlobalPortFree.description: The lowest port number that will be assigned dynamical by BCAM

bcamGlobalNumBitmap.name: bcamGlobalNumBitmap
bcamGlobalNumBitmap.description: The number of bitmaps to administer slots in the data slot pool. Every bitmap can administer 2048 slots. So the maximum number of slots in a pool is bcamGlobalNumBitmap*2048

bcamGlobalMaxRemoteIp.name: bcamGlobalMaxRemoteIp
bcamGlobalMaxRemoteIp.description: The maximum length in bytes BCAM uses for an NSDU for an endsystem that is reached over at least one router

bcamGlobalEsCreationIp.name: bcamGlobalEsCreationIp
bcamGlobalEsCreationIp.description: The types of IP protocols that will lead to automatic endsystem creation: ipOff (1) : no automatic endsystem creation due to IP protocols. ipInData (2) : automatic endsystem creation due to IP data received. ipOutData (4) : automatic endsystem creation due to IP data sent. ipRoutingProt (8) : automatic endsystem creation due to IP routing protocols. ipRoutingData (16) : automatic endsystem creation due to routed IP protocols.

bcamGlobalEsCreationIso.name: bcamGlobalEsCreationIso
bcamGlobalEsCreationIso.description: The types of ISO 8473 and ISO 9542 protocols that will lead to automatic endsystem creation: isoOff (1) : no automatic endsystem creation due to ISO protocols. isoInData (2) : automatic endsystem creation due to ISO data received. isoOutData (4) : automatic endsystem creation due to ISO data sent. isoRoutingProt (8) : automatic endsystem creation due to ISO routing protocols. isoRoutingData (16) : automatic endsystem creation due to routed ISO protocols.

bcamGlobalBroadcast.name: bcamGlobalBroadcast
bcamGlobalBroadcast.description: Describes how incoming broadcasts will be treated. on (2) : broadcasts will be evaluated and answered if necessary. off (1) : broadcasts will be ignored.

bcamGlobalArp.name: bcamGlobalArp
bcamGlobalArp.description: Describes if the address resolution protocol is used. off (1) : no ARP will be used. quiet (2) : ARP will be used the first time a route is used and periodically if there exists a transport connection to the system described by this route and there was no data transfer in the last supervision interval. on (4) : ARP will be used the first time a route is used and periodically after the supervision interval.

bcamGlobalRarp.name: bcamGlobalRarp
bcamGlobalRarp.description: Describes if the reverse address resolution protocol will be supported. off (1) : RARP not supported. on (2) : RARP supported.

bcamGlobalInWaitLimit1.name: bcamGlobalInWaitLimit1
bcamGlobalInWaitLimit1.description: The lowest bucket limit for the recording of the input wait times in milliseconds. The input wait time is the time interval between the announcement of a message to an application and corresponding receive call. Every change will reset all counters for the input wait time.

bcamGlobalInWaitLimit2.name: bcamGlobalInWaitLimit2
bcamGlobalInWaitLimit2.description: The second bucket limit for the recording of the input wait times in milliseconds. The input wait time is the time interval between the announcement of a message to an application and corresponding receive call. Every change will reset all counters for the input wait time.

bcamGlobalInWaitLimit3.name: bcamGlobalInWaitLimit3
bcamGlobalInWaitLimit3.description: The third bucket limit for the recording of the input wait times in milliseconds. The input wait time is the time interval between the announcement of a message to an application and corresponding receive call. Every change will reset all counters for the input wait time.

bcamGlobalInWaitLimit4.name: bcamGlobalInWaitLimit4
bcamGlobalInWaitLimit4.description: The highest bucket limit for the recording of the input wait times in milliseconds. The input wait time is the time interval between the announcement of a message to an application and corresponding receive call. Every change will reset all counters for the input wait time.

bcamGlobalInWaitChange.name: bcamGlobalInWaitChange
bcamGlobalInWaitChange.description: The number of times the limits of the input wait time buckets have been changed.

bcamGlobalInWaitSet.name: bcamGlobalInWaitSet
bcamGlobalInWaitSet.description: The state of counting into the input wait time buckets. off (2) : the counting is stopped. on (1) : the counting is running.

bcamGlobalReactLimit1.name: bcamGlobalReactLimit1
bcamGlobalReactLimit1.description: The lowest bucket limit for the recording of the application reaction times in milliseconds. The application reaction time is the time interval between a receive call and a directly following send call. Every change will reset all counters for the application reaction time.

bcamGlobalReactLimit2.name: bcamGlobalReactLimit2
bcamGlobalReactLimit2.description: The second bucket limit for the recording of the application reaction times in milliseconds. The application reaction time is the time interval between a receive call and a directly following send call. Every change will reset all counters for the application reaction time.

bcamGlobalReactLimit3.name: bcamGlobalReactLimit3
bcamGlobalReactLimit3.description: The third bucket limit for the recording of the application reaction times in milliseconds. The application reaction time is the time interval between a receive call and a directly following send call. Every change will reset all counters for the application reaction time.

bcamGlobalReactLimit4.name: bcamGlobalReactLimit4
bcamGlobalReactLimit4.description: The highest bucket limit for the recording of the application reaction times in milliseconds. The application reaction time is the time interval between a receive call and a directly following send call. Every change will reset all counters for the application reaction time.

bcamGlobalReactChange.name: bcamGlobalReactChange
bcamGlobalReactChange.description: The number of times the limits of the application reaction time buckets have been changed.

bcamGlobalReactSet.name: bcamGlobalReactSet
bcamGlobalReactSet.description: The state of counting into the application reaction time buckets. off (2) : the counting is stopped. on (1) : the counting is running.

bcamGlobalInProcLimit1.name: bcamGlobalInProcLimit1
bcamGlobalInProcLimit1.description: The lowest bucket limit for the recording of the inbound processing times in milliseconds. The inbound processing time is the time interval between the arrival of the first byte of a message at layer 2 and the receive of the last byte this message by the application. Every change will reset all counters for the inbound processing time.

bcamGlobalInProcLimit2.name: bcamGlobalInProcLimit2
bcamGlobalInProcLimit2.description: The second bucket limit for the recording of the inbound processing times in milliseconds. The inbound processing time is the time interval between the arrival of the first byte of a message at layer 2 and the receive of the last byte this message by the application. Every change will reset all counters for the inbound processing time.

bcamGlobalInProcLimit3.name: bcamGlobalInProcLimit3
bcamGlobalInProcLimit3.description: The third bucket limit for the recording of the inbound processing times in milliseconds. The inbound processing time is the time interval between the arrival of the first byte of a message at layer 2 and the receive of the last byte this message by the application. Every change will reset all counters for the inbound processing time.

bcamGlobalInProcLimit4.name: bcamGlobalInProcLimit4
bcamGlobalInProcLimit4.description: The highest bucket limit for the recording of the inbound processing times in milliseconds. The inbound processing time is the time interval between the arrival of the first byte of a message at layer 2 and the receive of the last byte this message by the application. Every change will reset all counters for the inbound processing time.

bcamGlobalInProcChange.name: bcamGlobalInProcChange
bcamGlobalInProcChange.description: The number of times the limits of the inbound processing time buckets have been changed.

bcamGlobalInProcSet.name: bcamGlobalInProcSet
bcamGlobalInProcSet.description: The state of counting into the inbound processing time buckets. off (2) : the counting is stopped. on (1) : the counting is running.

bcamGlobalOutProcLimit1.name: bcamGlobalOutProcLimit1
bcamGlobalOutProcLimit1.description: The lowest bucket limit for the recording of the outbound processing times in milliseconds. The outbound processing time is the time interval between the send call of an application and the confirmation for the processing of the last byte of the message by layer 1. Every change will reset all counters for the outbound processing time.

bcamGlobalOutProcLimit2.name: bcamGlobalOutProcLimit2
bcamGlobalOutProcLimit2.description: The second bucket limit for the recording of the outbound processing times in milliseconds. The outbound processing time is the time interval between the send call of an application and the confirmation for the processing of the last byte of the message by layer 1. Every change will reset all counters for the outbound processing time.

bcamGlobalOutProcLimit3.name: bcamGlobalOutProcLimit3
bcamGlobalOutProcLimit3.description: The third bucket limit for the recording of the outbound processing times in milliseconds. The outbound processing time is the time interval between the send call of an application and the confirmation for the processing of the last byte of the message by layer 1. Every change will reset all counters for the outbound processing time.

bcamGlobalOutProcLimit4.name: bcamGlobalOutProcLimit4
bcamGlobalOutProcLimit4.description: The highest bucket limit for the recording of the outbound processing times in milliseconds. The outbound processing time is the time interval between the send call of an application and the confirmation for the processing of the last byte of the message by layer 1. Every change will reset all counters for the outbound processing time.

bcamGlobalOutProcChange.name: bcamGlobalOutProcChange
bcamGlobalOutProcChange.description: The number of times the limits of the outbound processing time buckets have been changed.

bcamGlobalOutProcSet.name: bcamGlobalOutProcSet
bcamGlobalOutProcSet.description: The state of counting into the outbound processing time buckets. off (2) : the counting is stopped. on (1) : the counting is running.

bcamGlobalSnmpRelease.name: bcamGlobalSnmpRelease
bcamGlobalSnmpRelease.description: The time interval in minutes for which the values for already closed connections and applications are still available.

bcamGlobalTrapPollInterval.name: bcamGlobalTrapPollInterval
bcamGlobalTrapPollInterval.description: The time interval in seconds after which the SNMP agent will poll for traps.

bcamGlobalFileApplTable.name: bcamGlobalFileApplTable
bcamGlobalFileApplTable.description: The name of the file that contains the assignments of NEA or ISO applications to the virtual host on which they shall run.

bcamGlobalFileSocketHostTable.name: bcamGlobalFileSocketHostTable
bcamGlobalFileSocketHostTable.description: The name of the file that contains the assignments of IP adresses to socket host names for automatic created endsystems.

bcamGlobalFileProcTable.name: bcamGlobalFileProcTable
bcamGlobalFileProcTable.description: The name of the file that contains the assignments of host names to net addresses for automatic created endsystems.

bcamGlobalAccessProcTable.name: bcamGlobalAccessProcTable
bcamGlobalAccessProcTable.description: The access of the file named in bcamGlobalFileProcTable: read (1) : only endsystems contained in the file will be created by automatic endsystem creation. update (2) : the file will be extended if a new endsystem is created.

bcamGlobalHostName.name: bcamGlobalHostName
bcamGlobalHostName.description: NEA name of the local endsystem

bcamMemoryClass3.name: bcamMemoryClass3
bcamMemoryClass3.description: The number of bytes of class 3 memory requested by BCAM.

bcamMemoryClass4.name: bcamMemoryClass4
bcamMemoryClass4.description: The number of bytes of class 4 memory requested by BCAM.

bcamMemoryLenLongEventSlot.name: bcamMemoryLenLongEventSlot
bcamMemoryLenLongEventSlot.description: The length of one long event slot in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccLongEventSlot.name: bcamMemoryOccLongEventSlot
bcamMemoryOccLongEventSlot.description: The number of long event slots currently used.

bcamMemoryLenShortEventSlot.name: bcamMemoryLenShortEventSlot
bcamMemoryLenShortEventSlot.description: The length of one short event slot in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccShortEventSlot.name: bcamMemoryOccShortEventSlot
bcamMemoryOccShortEventSlot.description: The number of short event slots currently used.

bcamMemoryLenTransParamSlot.name: bcamMemoryLenTransParamSlot
bcamMemoryLenTransParamSlot.description: The length of one transport parameter block in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccTransParamSlot.name: bcamMemoryOccTransParamSlot
bcamMemoryOccTransParamSlot.description: The number of transport parameter blocks currently used.

bcamMemoryLenSnmpParamSlot.name: bcamMemoryLenSnmpParamSlot
bcamMemoryLenSnmpParamSlot.description: The length of one SNMP parameter block in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccSnmpParamSlot.name: bcamMemoryOccSnmpParamSlot
bcamMemoryOccSnmpParamSlot.description: The number of SNMP parameter blocks currently used.

bcamMemoryLenApplCb.name: bcamMemoryLenApplCb
bcamMemoryLenApplCb.description: The length of one application control block in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccApplCb.name: bcamMemoryOccApplCb
bcamMemoryOccApplCb.description: The number of application control blocks currently used.

bcamMemoryLenEnaCb.name: bcamMemoryLenEnaCb
bcamMemoryLenEnaCb.description: The length of one control block in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccEnaCb.name: bcamMemoryOccEnaCb
bcamMemoryOccEnaCb.description: The number of control blocks currently used.

bcamMemoryLenExtApplCb.name: bcamMemoryLenExtApplCb
bcamMemoryLenExtApplCb.description: The length of one extended application control block in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccExtApplCb.name: bcamMemoryOccExtApplCb
bcamMemoryOccExtApplCb.description: The number of extended application control blocks currently used.

bcamMemoryLenShortResConn2.name: bcamMemoryLenShortResConn2
bcamMemoryLenShortResConn2.description: The length of one short resident connection control block 2 in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccShortResConn2.name: bcamMemoryOccShortResConn2
bcamMemoryOccShortResConn2.description: The number of short resident connection control blocks 2 currently used.

bcamMemoryLenLongResConn2.name: bcamMemoryLenLongResConn2
bcamMemoryLenLongResConn2.description: The length of one long resident connection control block 2 in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccLongResConn2.name: bcamMemoryOccLongResConn2
bcamMemoryOccLongResConn2.description: The number of long resident connection control blocks 2 currently used.

bcamMemoryLenShortPagConn1.name: bcamMemoryLenShortPagConn1
bcamMemoryLenShortPagConn1.description: The length of one short pageable connection control block 1 in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccShortPagConn1.name: bcamMemoryOccShortPagConn1
bcamMemoryOccShortPagConn1.description: The number of short pageable connection control blocks 1 currently used.

bcamMemoryLenSnmpConn.name: bcamMemoryLenSnmpConn
bcamMemoryLenSnmpConn.description: The length of one SNMP connection control block in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccSnmpConn.name: bcamMemoryOccSnmpConn
bcamMemoryOccSnmpConn.description: The number of SNMP connection control blocks currently used.

bcamMemoryLenLongPagConn1.name: bcamMemoryLenLongPagConn1
bcamMemoryLenLongPagConn1.description: The length of one long pageable connection control block 1 in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccLongPagConn1.name: bcamMemoryOccLongPagConn1
bcamMemoryOccLongPagConn1.description: The number of long pageable connection control blocks 1 currently used.

bcamMemoryLenShortPagConn2.name: bcamMemoryLenShortPagConn2
bcamMemoryLenShortPagConn2.description: The length of one short pageable connection control block 2 in bytes.

bcamMemoryOccShortPagConn2.name: bcamMemoryOccShortPagConn2
bcamMemoryOccShortPagConn2.description: The number of short pageable connection control blocks 2 currently used.

bcamMemoryPoolInputCurrent.name: bcamMemoryPoolInputCurrent
bcamMemoryPoolInputCurrent.description: The number of bytes of resident memory currently used for input cells

bcamMemoryPoolInputResume.name: bcamMemoryPoolInputResume
bcamMemoryPoolInputResume.description: Describes whether an interface waits for memory for input . If zero, some interfaces will not have enough input buffer( A cell request was rejected because bcamMemoryPoolInputCurrent exceeded bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap).

bcamMemoryPoolInputMonMax.name: bcamMemoryPoolInputMonMax
bcamMemoryPoolInputMonMax.description: The maximum number of bytes of resident memory used for input cells for the last 5 seconds.

bcamMemoryPoolInputMonMin.name: bcamMemoryPoolInputMonMin
bcamMemoryPoolInputMonMin.description: The minimum number of bytes of resident memory used for input cells for the last 5 seconds.

bcamMemoryPoolInputLimit.name: bcamMemoryPoolInputLimit
bcamMemoryPoolInputLimit.description: The maximum number of bytes of resident memory to be used for input cells.

bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap.name: bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap
bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap.description: The trap limit for the number of bytes of resident memory for input cells (if bcamMemoryPoolInputMonMin is greater than bcamMemoryPoolInputLimitTrap, a trap will be sent).

bcamMemoryPoolMaxResident.name: bcamMemoryPoolMaxResident
bcamMemoryPoolMaxResident.description: The maximum number of bytes of resident memory to be used for input and output cells.

bcamMemoryPoolMaxPageable.name: bcamMemoryPoolMaxPageable
bcamMemoryPoolMaxPageable.description: The maximum number of bytes of pageable memory to be used for input and output cells.

bcamMemoryPoolInputMaxPageable.name: bcamMemoryPoolInputMaxPageable
bcamMemoryPoolInputMaxPageable.description: The maximum number of bytes of pageable memory to be used for input cells.

bcamMemoryPoolOutputCurrent.name: bcamMemoryPoolOutputCurrent
bcamMemoryPoolOutputCurrent.description: The number of bytes of resident memory currently used for output cells.

bcamMemoryPoolOutputResume.name: bcamMemoryPoolOutputResume
bcamMemoryPoolOutputResume.description: Describes whether an interface waits for memory for output . If zero, some interfaces will not have enough output buffer( A cell request was rejected because bcamMemoryPoolOutputCurrent exceeded bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap).

bcamMemoryPoolOutputMonMax.name: bcamMemoryPoolOutputMonMax
bcamMemoryPoolOutputMonMax.description: The maximum number of bytes of resident memory used for output cells for the last 5 seconds.

bcamMemoryPoolOutputMonMin.name: bcamMemoryPoolOutputMonMin
bcamMemoryPoolOutputMonMin.description: The minimum number of bytes of resident memory used for output cells for the last 5 seconds.

bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimit.name: bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimit
bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimit.description: The maximum number of bytes of resident memory to be used for output cells.

bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap.name: bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap
bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap.description: The trap limit for the number of bytes of resident memory for output cells (if bcamMemoryPoolOutputMonMin is greater than bcamMemoryPoolOutputLimitTrap, a trap will be sent).

bcamMemoryPoolMaxCells.name: bcamMemoryPoolMaxCells
bcamMemoryPoolMaxCells.description: The maximum number of cells contained in every pool type.

bcamMemoryPoolOutputMaxPageable.name: bcamMemoryPoolOutputMaxPageable
bcamMemoryPoolOutputMaxPageable.description: The maximum number of bytes of pageable memory to be used for output cells.

bcamMemoryPoolRoutingCurrent.name: bcamMemoryPoolRoutingCurrent
bcamMemoryPoolRoutingCurrent.description: The number of bytes of resident memory currently used for routing cells

bcamMemoryPoolRoutingLimit.name: bcamMemoryPoolRoutingLimit
bcamMemoryPoolRoutingLimit.description: The maximum number of bytes of resident memory to be used for routing cells.

bcamMemoryPoolPageableCurrent.name: bcamMemoryPoolPageableCurrent
bcamMemoryPoolPageableCurrent.description: The number of bytes of pageable memory currently used for pools

bcamMemoryPoolPageableFixed.name: bcamMemoryPoolPageableFixed
bcamMemoryPoolPageableFixed.description: The number of bytes of pageable fixed memory currently used for output cells.

bcamMemoryCellReqSucc.name: bcamMemoryCellReqSucc
bcamMemoryCellReqSucc.description: The number of successful cell requests.

bcamMemoryCellReqResOutExceed.name: bcamMemoryCellReqResOutExceed
bcamMemoryCellReqResOutExceed.description: The number of requests for resident output cells that failed because the limit has been reached.

bcamMemoryCellReqResInExceed.name: bcamMemoryCellReqResInExceed
bcamMemoryCellReqResInExceed.description: The number of requests for resident input cells that failed because limit has been reached.

bcamMemoryCellReqTempExceed.name: bcamMemoryCellReqTempExceed
bcamMemoryCellReqTempExceed.description: The number of cell requests failed because of temporary shortage.

bcamMemoryCellReqBitmapFull.name: bcamMemoryCellReqBitmapFull
bcamMemoryCellReqBitmapFull.description: The number of cell requests failed because bitmap was full.

bcamMemoryCellReqNoMemory.name: bcamMemoryCellReqNoMemory
bcamMemoryCellReqNoMemory.description: The number of cell requests failed because memory request failed.

bcamMemoryCellReqPagInExceed.name: bcamMemoryCellReqPagInExceed
bcamMemoryCellReqPagInExceed.description: The number of requests for pageable input cells that failed because limit has been reached.

bcamMemoryCellReqPagOutExceed.name: bcamMemoryCellReqPagOutExceed
bcamMemoryCellReqPagOutExceed.description: The number of requests for pageable output cells that failed because limit has been reached.

bcamTraceSavingState.name: bcamTraceSavingState
bcamTraceSavingState.description: Describes if any of the running BCAM traces are saved to a file. noSaving (32) : no trace will be written initiated (1) : the trace saving task has been created active (2) : the trace saving task is active shutting (4) : the trace saving task is terminating passive (8) : the trace file has been closed waiting (16) : the trace saving task is waiting for trace data to write Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamTraceFilename.name: bcamTraceFilename
bcamTraceFilename.description: The name of the file currently used for saving BCAM traces.

bcamTraceMaxFilesize.name: bcamTraceMaxFilesize
bcamTraceMaxFilesize.description: The maximum size of one file used for saving BCAM traces in bytes.

bcamTraceNumberFiles.name: bcamTraceNumberFiles
bcamTraceNumberFiles.description: The number of files used for saving BCAM traces.

bcamTraceAdmState.name: bcamTraceAdmState
bcamTraceAdmState.description: The current state of the trace. stopped (8) : the trace is not running. running (1) : the trace is running. save (2) : the trace is running and saved to a file. hold (4) : the trace data will be kept in case of an error. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamTraceAdmNumberBuffer.name: bcamTraceAdmNumberBuffer
bcamTraceAdmNumberBuffer.description: The number of buffers used for the trace

bcamTraceAdmBufferLen.name: bcamTraceAdmBufferLen
bcamTraceAdmBufferLen.description: The length of one trace buffer in bytes (rounded up to multiples of 256).

bcamTraceBasicState.name: bcamTraceBasicState
bcamTraceBasicState.description: The current state of the trace. stopped (8) : the trace is not running. running (1) : the trace is running. save (2) : the trace is running and saved to a file. hold (4) : the trace data will be kept in case of an error. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamTraceBasicNumberBuffer.name: bcamTraceBasicNumberBuffer
bcamTraceBasicNumberBuffer.description: The number of buffers used for the trace

bcamTraceBasicBufferLen.name: bcamTraceBasicBufferLen
bcamTraceBasicBufferLen.description: The length of one trace buffer in bytes (rounded up to multiples of 256).

bcamTraceConnState.name: bcamTraceConnState
bcamTraceConnState.description: The current state of the trace. stopped (8) : the trace is not running. running (1) : the trace is running. save (2) : the trace is running and saved to a file. hold (4) : the trace data will be kept in case of an error. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamTraceConnNumberBuffer.name: bcamTraceConnNumberBuffer
bcamTraceConnNumberBuffer.description: The number of buffers used for the trace

bcamTraceConnBufferLen.name: bcamTraceConnBufferLen
bcamTraceConnBufferLen.description: The length of one trace buffer in bytes (rounded up to multiples of 256).

bcamTraceLocalState.name: bcamTraceLocalState
bcamTraceLocalState.description: The current state of the trace. stopped (8) : the trace is not running. running (1) : the trace is running. save (2) : the trace is running and saved to a file. hold (4) : the trace data will be kept in case of an error. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamTraceLocalNumberBuffer.name: bcamTraceLocalNumberBuffer
bcamTraceLocalNumberBuffer.description: The number of buffers used for the trace

bcamTraceLocalBufferLen.name: bcamTraceLocalBufferLen
bcamTraceLocalBufferLen.description: The length of one trace buffer in bytes (rounded up to multiples of 256).

bcamTraceMappingState.name: bcamTraceMappingState
bcamTraceMappingState.description: The current state of the trace. stopped (8) : the trace is not running. running (1) : the trace is running. save (2) : the trace is running and saved to a file. hold (4) : the trace data will be kept in case of an error. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamTraceMappingNumberBuffer.name: bcamTraceMappingNumberBuffer
bcamTraceMappingNumberBuffer.description: The number of buffers used for the trace

bcamTraceMappingBufferLen.name: bcamTraceMappingBufferLen
bcamTraceMappingBufferLen.description: The length of one trace buffer in bytes (rounded up to multiples of 256).

bcamTraceMgmtState.name: bcamTraceMgmtState

bcamTsapRecvByteLow.name: bcamTsapRecvByteLow
bcamTsapRecvByteLow.description: Number of bytes given from BCAM to all TSAPs since start of BCAM (low word, add to high word).

bcamTsapTabState.description: The current state of this application. opening (1) : the application enableing is in progress. open (2): the application is ready for requesting or accepting connections. closing (3): the termination of the application is in progress. closed (4): the application has been closed. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamCepTabOutbufTsduSend.name: bcamCepTabOutbufTsduSend
bcamCepTabOutbufTsduSend.description: The number of packets to send that are currently buffered by BCAM for this connection.

bcamCepTabOutbufByteSend.description: The number of bytes to send that are currently buffered by BCAM for this connection.

bcamCepTabOutbufMaxTsduSend.name: bcamCepTabOutbufMaxTsduSend
bcamCepTabOutbufMaxTsduSend.description: The maximum number of packets to send that will be buffered by BCAM for this connection.

bcamCepTabOutbufMaxByteSend.name: bcamCepTabOutbufMaxByteSend
bcamCepTabOutbufMaxByteSend.description: The maximum number of bytes to send that will be buffered by BCAM for this connection.

bcamCepTabInbufTsdu.name: bcamCepTabInbufTsdu
bcamCepTabInbufTsdu.description: The number of packets to receive that are currently buffered by BCAM for this connection.

bcamCepTabInbufByte.description: The number of bytes to receive that are currently buffered by BCAM for this connection.

bcamCepTabPacketsWindowReceiveds.description: The number of packets received by BCAM that contained only window information.

bcamCepTabApplicationNumber.name: bcamCepTabApplicationNumber

bcamCepTabDuration.name: bcamCepTabDuration

bcamCepTabDateConnectionEstablishment.name: bcamCepTabDateConnectionEstablishment

bcamCepTabTimeConnectionEstablishment.name: bcamCepTabTimeConnectionEstablishment

bcamCepTabTypPartnerName.name: bcamCepTabTypPartnerName
bcamCepTabTypPartnerName.description: The type of name used for the partner application. neaName (1) : the name consists of 8 byte application name and 8 byte name of endsystem. socketName (2) : the name consists of up to 32 byte socket name. isoName (3) : the name consists of up to 78 byte iso name.

bcamCepTabPartnerName.name: bcamCepTabPartnerName
bcamCepTabPartnerName.description: The name of the partner application according the type of the name (bcamCepTabTypPartnerName).

bcamCepTabLocalName.name: bcamCepTabLocalName
bcamCepTabLocalName.description: The name of the local application according the type of the name (bcamCepTabTypPartnerName).

bcamCepTabTypeL4Addr.name: bcamCepTabTypeL4Addr
bcamCepTabTypeL4Addr.description: The type of layer 4 addresses used for this connection. portNumber (1) : the address consists of 2 byte port number. neaTsel (2) : the address consists of 8 byte NEA transport selector. osiTsel (3) : the address consists of up to 33 byte OSI transport selector.

bcamCepTabL4AddrPartner.name: bcamCepTabL4AddrPartner
bcamCepTabL4AddrPartner.description: The layer 4 address of the partner application according the type of the address (bcamCepTabTypeL4Addr).

bcamCepTabL4AddrLocal.name: bcamCepTabL4AddrLocal
bcamCepTabL4AddrLocal.description: The layer 4 address of the partner application according the type of the address (bcamCepTabTypeL4Addr).

bcamCepTabPartnerEndsystem.name: bcamCepTabPartnerEndsystem
bcamCepTabPartnerEndsystem.description: The name of the host where the partner application resides.

bcamCepTabInWaitBuck1.name: bcamCepTabInWaitBuck1
bcamCepTabInWaitBuck1.description: The number of times the input wait time was in the time interval between zero and bcamGlobalInWaitLimit1.

bcamCepTabInWaitBuck2.name: bcamCepTabInWaitBuck2
bcamCepTabInWaitBuck2.description: The number of times the input wait time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalInWaitLimit1 and bcamGlobalInWaitLimit2.

bcamCepTabInWaitBuck3.name: bcamCepTabInWaitBuck3
bcamCepTabInWaitBuck3.description: The number of times the input wait time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalInWaitLimit2 and bcamGlobalInWaitLimit3.

bcamCepTabInWaitBuck4.name: bcamCepTabInWaitBuck4
bcamCepTabInWaitBuck4.description: The number of times the input wait time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalInWaitLimit3 and bcamGlobalInWaitLimit4.

bcamCepTabInWaitBuck5.name: bcamCepTabInWaitBuck5
bcamCepTabInWaitBuck5.description: The number of times the input wait time was longer than bcamGlobalInWaitLimit4.

bcamCepTabReactBuck1.name: bcamCepTabReactBuck1
bcamCepTabReactBuck1.description: The number of times the application reaction time was in the time interval between zero and bcamGlobalReactLimit1.

bcamCepTabReactBuck2.name: bcamCepTabReactBuck2
bcamCepTabReactBuck2.description: The number of times the application reaction time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalReactLimit1 and bcamGlobalReactLimit2.

bcamCepTabReactBuck3.name: bcamCepTabReactBuck3
bcamCepTabReactBuck3.description: The number of times the application reaction time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalReactLimit2 and bcamGlobalReactLimit3

bcamCepTabReactBuck4.name: bcamCepTabReactBuck4
bcamCepTabReactBuck4.description: The number of times the application reaction time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalReactLimit3 and bcamGlobalReactLimit4.

bcamCepTabReactBuck5.name: bcamCepTabReactBuck5
bcamCepTabReactBuck5.description: The number of times the application reaction time was longer than bcamGlobalReactLimit4.

bcamCepTabOutProcBuck1.name: bcamCepTabOutProcBuck1
bcamCepTabOutProcBuck1.description: The number of times the outbound processing time was in the time interval between zero and bcamGlobalOutProcLimit1.

bcamCepTabOutProcBuck2.name: bcamCepTabOutProcBuck2
bcamCepTabOutProcBuck2.description: The number of times the outbound processing time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalOutProcLimit1 and bcamGlobalOutProcLimit2.

bcamCepTabOutProcBuck3.name: bcamCepTabOutProcBuck3
bcamCepTabOutProcBuck3.description: The number of times the outbound processing time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalOutProcLimit2 and bcamGlobalOutProcLimit3.

bcamCepTabOutProcBuck4.name: bcamCepTabOutProcBuck4
bcamCepTabOutProcBuck4.description: The number of times the outbound processing time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalOutProcLimit3 and bcamGlobalOutProcLimit4.

bcamCepTabOutProcBuck5.name: bcamCepTabOutProcBuck5
bcamCepTabOutProcBuck5.description: The number of times the outbound processing time was longer than bcamGlobalOutProcLimit4.

bcamCepTabInProcBuck1.name: bcamCepTabInProcBuck1
bcamCepTabInProcBuck1.description: The number of times the inbound processing time was in the time interval between zero and bcamGlobalInProcLimit1.

bcamCepTabInProcBuck2.name: bcamCepTabInProcBuck2
bcamCepTabInProcBuck2.description: The number of times the inbound processing time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalInProcLimit1 and bcamGlobalInProcLimit2.

bcamCepTabInProcBuck3.name: bcamCepTabInProcBuck3
bcamCepTabInProcBuck3.description: The number of times the inbound processing time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalInProcLimit2 and bcamGlobalInProcLimit3.

bcamCepTabInProcBuck4.name: bcamCepTabInProcBuck4
bcamCepTabInProcBuck4.description: The number of times the inbound processing time was in the time interval between bcamGlobalInProcLimit3 and bcamGlobalInProcLimit4.

bcamCepTabInProcBuck5.name: bcamCepTabInProcBuck5
bcamCepTabInProcBuck5.description: The number of times the inbound processing time was longer than bcamGlobalInProcLimit4.

bcamCepTabMaxSendLen.name: bcamCepTabMaxSendLen
bcamCepTabMaxSendLen.description: The maximum number of bytes per send call that can be given to BCAM at the interface.

bcamCepTabMaxIndLen.name: bcamCepTabMaxIndLen
bcamCepTabMaxIndLen.description: The maximum number of bytes BCAM will announce per data indication.

bcamCepTabLocalEndsystem.name: bcamCepTabLocalEndsystem
bcamCepTabLocalEndsystem.description: The name of the host where the local application resides.

bcamRouteNumTable.name: bcamRouteNumTable
bcamRouteNumTable.description: The number of all routes known by BCAM

bcamRouteArpDefault.name: bcamRouteArpDefault
bcamRouteArpDefault.description: The ARP state to use as default when a route of type node (bcamRouteTabTyp) is activated. Several bits may be set simultaneous. off (1) : No usage of ARP. on (2) : periodic usage of ARP. quiet (4) : ARP will only be used if no connection oriented data were transferred during the last ARP period.

bcamRouteRoutingReqIp.name: bcamRouteRoutingReqIp
bcamRouteRoutingReqIp.description: The number of forwarding requests for IP

bcamRouteRoutingReqIso.name: bcamRouteRoutingReqIso
bcamRouteRoutingReqIso.description: The number of forwarding requests for ISO

bcamRouteRoutingReqNea.name: bcamRouteRoutingReqNea
bcamRouteRoutingReqNea.description: The number of forwarding requests for NEA

bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqIp.name: bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqIp
bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqIp.description: The number of successful forwarding requests for IP

bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqIso.name: bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqIso
bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqIso.description: The number of successful forwarding requests for ISO

bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqNea.name: bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqNea
bcamRouteSuccRoutingReqNea.description: The number of successful forwarding requests for NEA

bcamRouteTabNumbers.name: bcamRouteTabNumbers
bcamRouteTabNumbers.description: The definite identifier for this route.

bcamRouteTabNumNeaConn.name: bcamRouteTabNumNeaConn
bcamRouteTabNumNeaConn.description: The current number of NEA connections using this route.

bcamRouteTabNumIsoConn.name: bcamRouteTabNumIsoConn
bcamRouteTabNumIsoConn.description: The current number of ISO and TCP connections using this route.

bcamRouteTabMaxNeaConn.name: bcamRouteTabMaxNeaConn
bcamRouteTabMaxNeaConn.description: The maximum number of NEA connections allowed for this route.

bcamRouteTabMaxIsoConn.name: bcamRouteTabMaxIsoConn
bcamRouteTabMaxIsoConn.description: The maximum number of ISO and TCP connections allowed for this route.

bcamRouteTabBadNeaElems.name: bcamRouteTabBadNeaElems
bcamRouteTabBadNeaElems.description: The number of erroneous NEA fragments received on this route.

bcamRouteTabBadIsoElems.name: bcamRouteTabBadIsoElems
bcamRouteTabBadIsoElems.description: The number of erroneous ISO and TCP fragments received on this route.

bcamRouteTabMaxL4Conn.name: bcamRouteTabMaxL4Conn
bcamRouteTabMaxL4Conn.description: The maximum number of layer 4 connections per layer 3 connection for this route.

bcamRouteTabMaxUnackTpdu.name: bcamRouteTabMaxUnackTpdu
bcamRouteTabMaxUnackTpdu.description: The maximum number of unacknowledged TPDUs per layer 3 connection that may be sent over this route.

bcamRouteTabRouteNetTyp.name: bcamRouteTabRouteNetTyp
bcamRouteTabRouteNetTyp.description: Describes whether there are other intermediate routes necessary to be known by BCAM to reach the system described by this route. gatewayRouter (1) : the system is reached via a gateway route. neaRouter (2) : the system is reached via a NEA router route. intfIpRouter (4) : the system is reached via an INTF or IP router route. int0Router (8) : the system is reached via an INT0 router route. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabNumberIsoIpRouter.name: bcamRouteTabNumberIsoIpRouter
bcamRouteTabNumberIsoIpRouter.description: The number of the route which describes the INT0, INTF or IP router used to reach the system described by this route.

bcamRouteTabNumberNeaRouter.name: bcamRouteTabNumberNeaRouter
bcamRouteTabNumberNeaRouter.description: The number of the route which describes the NEA router used to reach the system described by this route.

bcamRouteTabNumberGateway.name: bcamRouteTabNumberGateway
bcamRouteTabNumberGateway.description: The number of the route which describes the gateway used to reach the system described by this route.

bcamRouteTabFunction.name: bcamRouteTabFunction
bcamRouteTabFunction.description: Describes the function of the route: onlyServerAccess (1) : the route is used for access to a specified server port only. transportRoute (2) : the route leads to an endsystem Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabProcNetTyp.name: bcamRouteTabProcNetTyp
bcamRouteTabProcNetTyp.description: Describes whether there are other intermediate systems necessary to be known by BCAM to reach the system described by this route. gatewayProc (1) : an intermediate gateway system is used. neaProc (2) : an intermediate NEA system is used. isoIpProc (4) : an intermediate ISO or IP system is used. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabMaxTsduLen.name: bcamRouteTabMaxTsduLen
bcamRouteTabMaxTsduLen.description: The maximum length of packets that can be sent over this route.

bcamRouteTabNameEndsystem.name: bcamRouteTabNameEndsystem
bcamRouteTabNameEndsystem.description: The name of the remote system described by this route.

bcamRouteTabIso4WindowTimer.name: bcamRouteTabIso4WindowTimer
bcamRouteTabIso4WindowTimer.description: The current value of the window timer for this route in seconds.

bcamRouteTabIso4RetransTimer.name: bcamRouteTabIso4RetransTimer
bcamRouteTabIso4RetransTimer.description: The current value of the retransmit timer for this route in seconds.

bcamRouteTabAckTimer.name: bcamRouteTabAckTimer
bcamRouteTabAckTimer.description: The current value of the acknowledgement timer for this route in seconds.

bcamRouteTabErrorRecovTimer.name: bcamRouteTabErrorRecovTimer
bcamRouteTabErrorRecovTimer.description: The current value of the error recovery timer for this route in seconds.

bcamRouteTabRejectTimer.name: bcamRouteTabRejectTimer
bcamRouteTabRejectTimer.description: The current value of the reject timer for this route in seconds.

bcamRouteTabExpedRetransTimer.name: bcamRouteTabExpedRetransTimer
bcamRouteTabExpedRetransTimer.description: The current value of the expedited retransmit timer for this route in seconds.

bcamRouteTabNameGateway.name: bcamRouteTabNameGateway
bcamRouteTabNameGateway.description: The name of the intermediate system where protocol transitions, if necessary for this route, are done.

bcamRouteTabNameX25Station.name: bcamRouteTabNameX25Station
bcamRouteTabNameX25Station.description: The name of the station which performs the X25 net access.

bcamRouteTabL3InputProfil.name: bcamRouteTabL3InputProfil
bcamRouteTabL3InputProfil.description: The input profile used on the network layer. nea (1) : proprietary NEAN protocol. int0 (2) : protocol according ISO 8473 (inactive network layer). intf (3) : protocol according ISO 8473. gateway (4) : no network layer protocol used. ip (5) : proctocol according RFC 791.

bcamRouteTabTransState.name: bcamRouteTabTransState
bcamRouteTabTransState.description: The current transfer state of this route as viewed by transport layer. notReady (4) : no packets can be sent. waitForTransferInit (1) : route may be initialised. waitForReadyToTransfer (2) : address resolution running ready (3) : packets may be sent

bcamRouteTabOption.name: bcamRouteTabOption
bcamRouteTabOption.description: The currently valid options for this route (only valid for TCP). delayedAckAllowed (1) : do not try do minimize the number of outgoing acknowledgements optimalSegmentSizeOn (2) : do not try do minimize the number of incoming acknowledgements Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabTyp.name: bcamRouteTabTyp
bcamRouteTabTyp.description: Describes how the remote system described by this route is reached. direct (1) : the remote system is connected directly to the local system (e.g via DAST). remote (2) : the remote system is reached via at least one router. node (3) : the remote system is connected directly to ethernet or fddi node.

bcamRouteTabUsage.name: bcamRouteTabUsage
bcamRouteTabUsage.description: Describes whether this route describes an intermediate system. noIntermediate (16) : no intermediate route gatewayRouter (1) : route describes an intermediate system used as gateway intfIpRouter (2) : route describes an INTF or an IP router neaRouter (4) : route describes a NEA router int0Router (8) : route describes an INT0 router Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabL3Subprofile.name: bcamRouteTabL3Subprofile
bcamRouteTabL3Subprofile.description: rfc1042 (1) : a layer 3 subprotocol according RFC1042 is used on this route. netConnLess (2) : a connectionless layer 3 protocol is used on this route. neaNetConn (4) : a NEA net connection is used on this route. neattNetConn (8) : a NEATT net connection is used on this route. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabCommandState.name: bcamRouteTabCommandState
bcamRouteTabCommandState.description: The current state of this route caused by route specific commands. included (1) : a BCIN command was given successfully for this route. active (2) : a BCACT command was given successfully for this route. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabChangeState.name: bcamRouteTabChangeState
bcamRouteTabChangeState.description: Describes how the route was defined or modified. generated (16) : the route has been defined by KOGS and not been modified. dynamic (1) : the route was created dynamically by a BCIN command. defByProtocol (2) : the route was defined by routing protocol. switchByProtocol (4) : the route has been switched by routing protocol. changed (8) : the route has been modified. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabIso9542.name: bcamRouteTabIso9542
bcamRouteTabIso9542.description: Describes the ISO9542 processing, if this route is an INTF route eshReceived (1) : endsystem hello received ishReceived (2) : intermediate system hello received. iso8473QueryReceived (4) : ISO 8473 query configuration request received. refreshRequired (8) : refreshing of routing information is required. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabMaxNetLength.name: bcamRouteTabMaxNetLength
bcamRouteTabMaxNetLength.description: The maximum length of a packet used on layer 3 (only valid for FDDI routes). ethernet (1) : the length will be limited to the maximum length for ethernet. fddi (2) : the length will be limited to the maximum length for FDDI.

bcamRouteTabState2.name: bcamRouteTabState2
bcamRouteTabState2.description: Describes the state of the route viewed by routing protocols. silent (16) : route not yet or no more used. testing (1) : delivery problems on route detected. working (2) : route working. waitAddressResolution (4) : waiting for address resolution. lifetimeSupervsionFailed (8) : lifetime supervision failed. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabDeactReason.name: bcamRouteTabDeactReason
bcamRouteTabDeactReason.description: The reason for the deactivation of the route. flush (1) : an ISO9542 protocol element that requests the invalidation of the routing information has been received. supposedDown (2) : the route is supposed to be down (derived from state of TCP protocol machine or ICMP message received). noArpReply (4) : no arp reply has been received. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabSwitchType.name: bcamRouteTabSwitchType
bcamRouteTabSwitchType.description: The type of the last performed route switching. localRemote (1) : the route has been changed from local to remote route. remoteLocal (2) : the route has been changed from remote to local route. remoteRemote (4) : the route has been changed from remote to remote route. lsapChanged (8) : the route has been switched to another LSAPCB. lanAddrChanged (16) : the lan address of the route has been changed. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabReasonCreation.name: bcamRouteTabReasonCreation
bcamRouteTabReasonCreation.description: Describes the reason for the automatic creation of the route. incomingData (1) : the route has been created because of incoming data. outgoingData (2) : the route has been created because of outgoing data. routingProtocol (4) : the route has been created because of incoming routing protocol. routingData (8) : the route has been created because of data to be routed. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabOrigLanAddress.name: bcamRouteTabOrigLanAddress
bcamRouteTabOrigLanAddress.description: The MAC address (if known) of the remote endsystem or the first intermediate system of this route as used when the route has been created.

bcamRouteTabLanAddress.name: bcamRouteTabLanAddress
bcamRouteTabLanAddress.description: The current MAC address (if known) of the remote endsystem or the first intermediate system of this route.

bcamRouteTabTypAddress.name: bcamRouteTabTypAddress
bcamRouteTabTypAddress.description: The type of address used for this route. nea (1) : 2 byte (processor number and region number) intf (2) : up to 20 byte full internet address streams (3) : 4 byte IP address int0 (4) : 6 byte MAC address

bcamRouteTabLocalAddr.name: bcamRouteTabLocalAddr
bcamRouteTabLocalAddr.description: The layer 3 address of the local system described by this route according to bcamRouteTabTypAddress.

bcamRouteTabRemoteAddr.name: bcamRouteTabRemoteAddr
bcamRouteTabRemoteAddr.description: The layer 3 address of the remote system described by this route according to bcamRouteTabTypAddress.

bcamRouteTabOutPacketsDatas.name: bcamRouteTabOutPacketsDatas
bcamRouteTabOutPacketsDatas.description: The number of packets sent over this route that contained at least one byte of user data.

bcamRouteTabOutPacketsFlowControls.name: bcamRouteTabOutPacketsFlowControls
bcamRouteTabOutPacketsFlowControls.description: The number of packets sent over this route that contained only flow control information.

bcamRouteTabInPacketsDatas.name: bcamRouteTabInPacketsDatas
bcamRouteTabInPacketsDatas.description: The number of packets received on this route that contained at least one byte of user data.

bcamRouteTabInPacketsFlowControls.name: bcamRouteTabInPacketsFlowControls
bcamRouteTabInPacketsFlowControls.description: The number of packets received on this route that contained only flow control information.

bcamRouteTabOutRetransPackets.name: bcamRouteTabOutRetransPackets
bcamRouteTabOutRetransPackets.description: The number of packets sent over this route that contained at least one byte of user data that were already sent.

bcamRouteTabInDetectedGaps.name: bcamRouteTabInDetectedGaps
bcamRouteTabInDetectedGaps.description: The number of packets received where there was a gap between the highest already received byte and the lowest byte in the packet.

bcamRouteTabInDuplicatedPackets.name: bcamRouteTabInDuplicatedPackets
bcamRouteTabInDuplicatedPackets.description: The number of packets received that contained at least one byte of user data that has already been received

bcamRouteTabInIncorrectPackets.name: bcamRouteTabInIncorrectPackets
bcamRouteTabInIncorrectPackets.description: The number of erroneous packets received on this route.

bcamRouteTabRoundTripTimeClosed.name: bcamRouteTabRoundTripTimeClosed
bcamRouteTabRoundTripTimeClosed.description: The average round trip time on this route for meanwhile closed connections.

bcamRouteTabRoundTripTimeCurrent.name: bcamRouteTabRoundTripTimeCurrent
bcamRouteTabRoundTripTimeCurrent.description: The average round trip time on this route for currently open connections.

bcamRouteTabArpReqSend.name: bcamRouteTabArpReqSend
bcamRouteTabArpReqSend.description: The number of ARP requests sent for this route.

bcamRouteTabArpRepSend.name: bcamRouteTabArpRepSend
bcamRouteTabArpRepSend.description: The number of ARP replies sent for this route.

bcamRouteTabArpReqRec.name: bcamRouteTabArpReqRec
bcamRouteTabArpReqRec.description: The number of ARP requests received for this route.

bcamRouteTabArpRepRec.name: bcamRouteTabArpRepRec
bcamRouteTabArpRepRec.description: The number of ARP replies received for this route.

bcamRouteTabIcmpReq.name: bcamRouteTabIcmpReq
bcamRouteTabIcmpReq.description: The number of ICMP ECHO requests sent for this route.

bcamRouteTabIcmpReply.name: bcamRouteTabIcmpReply
bcamRouteTabIcmpReply.description: The number of ICMP ECHO replies received for this route.

bcamRouteTabIcmpRedirect.name: bcamRouteTabIcmpRedirect
bcamRouteTabIcmpRedirect.description: The number of ICMP redirects received for this route.

bcamRouteTabSwitched.name: bcamRouteTabSwitched
bcamRouteTabSwitched.description: The number of route switchings performed for this route.

bcamRouteTabDown.name: bcamRouteTabDown
bcamRouteTabDown.description: The number of times the state of the route has changed to not working.

bcamRouteTabOspfHello.name: bcamRouteTabOspfHello
bcamRouteTabOspfHello.description: The number of OSPF HELLOs received for this route.

bcamRouteTabPacketNoConn.name: bcamRouteTabPacketNoConn
bcamRouteTabPacketNoConn.description: The number of packets received on this route that could not be assigned to a connection.

bcamRouteTabPacketInternDiscon.name: bcamRouteTabPacketInternDiscon
bcamRouteTabPacketInternDiscon.description: The number of packets received on this route that resulted in an abortion of a connection.

bcamRouteTabPacketBadProtocol.name: bcamRouteTabPacketBadProtocol
bcamRouteTabPacketBadProtocol.description: The number of packets received on this route that were invalid.

bcamRouteTabConnReqOut.name: bcamRouteTabConnReqOut
bcamRouteTabConnReqOut.description: The number of connection requests sent on this route.

bcamRouteTabConnReqOutAck.name: bcamRouteTabConnReqOutAck
bcamRouteTabConnReqOutAck.description: The number of connection requests sent on this route that have been acknowledeged by the remote transport system.

bcamRouteTabConnReqOutRej.name: bcamRouteTabConnReqOutRej
bcamRouteTabConnReqOutRej.description: The number of connection requests sent on this route that have been rejected by the remote transport system.

bcamRouteTabConnReqIn.name: bcamRouteTabConnReqIn
bcamRouteTabConnReqIn.description: The number of connection requests received on this route.

bcamRouteTabConnReqInAck.name: bcamRouteTabConnReqInAck
bcamRouteTabConnReqInAck.description: The number of connection requests received on this route that have been acknowledged by the local transport system.

bcamRouteTabConnReqInRej.name: bcamRouteTabConnReqInRej
bcamRouteTabConnReqInRej.description: The number of connection requests received on this route that have been rejected by the local transport system.

bcamRouteTabDisconnOut.name: bcamRouteTabDisconnOut
bcamRouteTabDisconnOut.description: The number of disconnect requests sent.

bcamRouteTabDisconnOutAck.name: bcamRouteTabDisconnOutAck
bcamRouteTabDisconnOutAck.description: The number of disconnect requests sent that have been acknowledged by the remote transport system.

bcamRouteTabDisconnIn.name: bcamRouteTabDisconnIn
bcamRouteTabDisconnIn.description: The number of disconnect requests received.

bcamRouteTabDisconnInAck.name: bcamRouteTabDisconnInAck
bcamRouteTabDisconnInAck.description: The number of disconnect requests received that have been acknowledged by the local transport system.

bcamRouteTabNumberLink.name: bcamRouteTabNumberLink
bcamRouteTabNumberLink.description: The number of the interface that is used for this route.

bcamRouteTabArpFlag.name: bcamRouteTabArpFlag
bcamRouteTabArpFlag.description: The ARP state of the route. off (1) : no usage of ARP. on (2) : periodic usage of ARP. quiet (4) : ARP will only be used if no connection oriented data were transferred during the last ARP period. Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamRouteTabNsduLen.name: bcamRouteTabNsduLen
bcamRouteTabNsduLen.description: The length of a network service data unit used on this route

bcamRouteTabMinNsduLen.name: bcamRouteTabMinNsduLen
bcamRouteTabMinNsduLen.description: The minimum maximal length of a network service data unit used on this route

bcamRouteTabMaxNsduLen.name: bcamRouteTabMaxNsduLen
bcamRouteTabMaxNsduLen.description: The maximum maximal length of a network service data unit used on this route

bcamIfTabNumbers.name: bcamIfTabNumbers
bcamIfTabNumbers.description: A definite identifier for the interface. Serves for references from other tables

bcamIfTabProfile.name: bcamIfTabProfile
bcamIfTabProfile.description: The layer 2 profile of this interface nealkp (1) : proprietary link protocol with permanent dialog. nealke (2) : proprietary event driven link protocol to BS2000 system. nealkeS (3) : proprietary event driven link protocol to System 6000. nealkh (4) : a HDLC balanced link protocol (duplex mode). llc1 (5) : CSMA/CD link protocol. sinix (6) : proprietary link protocol to SINIX port. fddi (7) : FDDI link protocol.

bcamIfTabMnemonicWrite.name: bcamIfTabMnemonicWrite
bcamIfTabMnemonicWrite.description: The device mnemonic for write operations

bcamIfTabMnemonicRead.name: bcamIfTabMnemonicRead
bcamIfTabMnemonicRead.description: The device mnemonic for read operations

bcamIfTabConfigUpdate.name: bcamIfTabConfigUpdate
bcamIfTabConfigUpdate.description: Describes whether assigned routes are allowed to be switched from this to an alternative interface. updateAllowed (4) : switching allowed updateForbidden (1) : switching forbidden primaryRequested (2) : switch back of all routes original assigned to this interface requested Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamIfTabMaxLpdu.name: bcamIfTabMaxLpdu
bcamIfTabMaxLpdu.description: The maximum length of a link protocol data unit depending on bcamIfTabProfile. ethernet (1514) : 1514 bytes fddi (4494) : 4494 bytes atm (65535) : 65535 bytes nealkh (65549) : 65549 bytes nealkp (4113) : 4113 bytes maxReass (16392) : 16392 bytes

bcamIfTabL2Monitoring.name: bcamIfTabL2Monitoring
bcamIfTabL2Monitoring.description: The state of the layer 2 monitoring. on (1) : layer 2 monitoring is running. off (2) : layer 2 monitoring is not running.

bcamIfTabDevice.name: bcamIfTabDevice
bcamIfTabDevice.description: Describes whether the interface is an ESCON channel to channel adapter. esconCtc (1) : the interface is an ESCON channel to channel adapter.

bcamIfTabAdminState.name: bcamIfTabAdminState
bcamIfTabAdminState.description: The administrative state of this interface requested by commands. excluded (4) : no BCIN command given included (1) : BCIN command given active (2) : BCACT command given

bcamIfTabCurrentState.name: bcamIfTabCurrentState
bcamIfTabCurrentState.description: The actual working state of this interface none (8) : interface not working waitForAct (1) : activation in progress working (2) : interface working waitForDeact (4) : deactivation in progress Several bits may be set simultaneous.

bcamIfTabMode.name: bcamIfTabMode
